Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements time for each guests at the event.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Amrit Thapa

    • Field Summary

      //tracks how many times a user has added times to timeSlots and timeSlot array.

      boolean[] timeSlots
      stores if there is 30 minutes or not.

    • Field Detail

      • timeSlots

        public boolean[] timeSlots
        stores if there is 30 minutes or not. true indicates 30 minutes. false indicates 0 minute.

      • timeSlot

        public int[] timeSlot
        //stores the military time.

      • pickednum

        public int pickednum
        //tracks how many times a user has added times to timeSlots and timeSlot array.

    • Method Detail

      • getTime

        public static Time getTime(int militaryHours,
                           boolean halfHour)
        This function is used to access the constructor.
        Parameters:
        militaryHours - Represents military time. 0-23
        halfHour - Represents 30 minutes.
        Returns:
        returns the Time class. returns null if the militaryHour is invalid.

      • getMilitaryTimeSlots

        public int[] getMilitaryTimeSlots()
        Returns:
        returns array where all the military time is stored.

      • gethalfHourTimeSlots

        public boolean[] gethalfHourTimeSlots()
        Returns:
        returns array where all the halfHour time is stored.

      • tellTime

        public void tellTime()
        prints all the times a guest has picked in 12 hours mode.

      • addTime

        public boolean addTime(int militaryHours,
                       boolean halfHour)
        adds time to the timeSlots and timeSlot arrays.
        Parameters:
        militaryHours - Represents military time. 0-23
        halfHour - Represents 30 minutes.
        Returns:
        returns false if military time is invalid. returns true is the time is added.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of this application.
        Parameters:
        args - array of string arguments.
